segments.text: My attention is drawn back to the boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His balance seems incredibly precarious, almost an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The two-step stool's legs are clearly splayed outward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's tilted noticeably backward, toward the wall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's really stretching himself to reach that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His whole body is elongated, making his center of gravity quite high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I keep expecting to see him lose his footing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A sudden shift could send him tumbling to the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He might fall onto that wet floor near the sink area.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Or he could hit the counter or the open cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me so nervous just watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can he be so focused on those cookies, ignoring the danger?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl standing there, just waiting, also seems oblivious to the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them, tell them to be careful.
segments.speaker: PAR
